article.headline: Coppin St. 73, Morgan St. 60
article.story: BALTIMORE -- Jordan Lee scored 19 points in only 23 minutes and Coppin State rode a hot second half to a 73-60 victory over cross-town rival Morgan State on Thursday night in the regular-season finale for both teams. The Eagles (16-13, 11-5 Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference) trailed 30-28 at halftime after shooting only 39.3 percent from the field (11 of 28). But they caught fire in the second half, making 13 of 21 shots (61.9 percent), getting 15 points off Morgan State turnovers, outscoring the Bears 45-30 and winning their fourth in the last five games. Vince Goldsberry added 16 points for Coppin State and Michael Harper had 14. DeWayne Jackson added 16 and Kevin Thompson 14 for the Bears (15-13, 10-6), who went the final 4:21 without a field goal and lost their third in a row. Capitalizing on that scoring drought, the Eagles turned what was a three-point game into their biggest lead.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
